Reviews.Title: “OK but a no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonAdam
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly, welcoming and helpful staff and a very clean hotel in quite a good, quiet location. The hotel is in the Charlottenburg district of Berlin and has many good restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood. If you turn right out of the hotel, you will be on one of Berlin's main streets (Kurfürstendamm) in 10 minutes or less. The hotel is OK for one or two nights but it offers an essentially no frills experience and is not 4 star in my opinion; it reminded me of a Travelodge hotel in the UK. We had single beds (i.e. narrow/child style ones) and the flattest pillows I have ever had in a hotel. We had to ask for more pillows but this made little difference. The room temperature was also difficult to control but there was a window to open which made a difference. No tea/coffee in the rooms but there is a minibar. I would advise other people to take their own shower gel/shampoo as the soap attached to the wall of the shower was empty after two squeezes! Free Wifi is not available; fees apply and although Internet is available in reception, this is also another chargeable service. The hotel offers a basic product but the staff were great and it is a very clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Stewart268
Reviews.Content: Small roomed hotel in remote residential neighborhood. Overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard - but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Doofed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights during a fair in Berlin. The room was decent, clean but rather dated furniture. The wifi was not included, which always make me annoyed and slightly angry. Front staff was very friendly and helpful though, check-in and check-out procedures were fast and efficient. Breakfast was ok, if ordered they serve you proper espresso instead of the brewed mud on the tables. The hotel is good, but the price tag is a bit hefty for the quality quite frankly. I don't know if they hike the prices because of the fair, but you should be able to get a better hotel for that money in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: blueocean201016
Reviews.Content: Park Inn Emser Strasse Berlin has attained service niravana . It offers the perfect blend of efficiency and friendliness. I arrive on a minus nine snowy Feb evening . The bespectacled senior receptionist sees me step out of my taxi and strides out to assist me with my luggage.Addresses me by name and welcomes me back ! Am I in Four Seasons or what ! I have stayed here 16 times since 2003 .Since 2004 have given me my favourite room with terrace overlooking the school yard EACH time . The rooms are spacious , have large windows through which natural light bathes the inside. Some of the rooms are decorated in a beautiful blue colour . The welcome amenities are classy . The bathrooms are spacious and stylish.The toiletries are better than you would expect in a European hotel of this rate.But above all the staff at the reception , the bar and the breakfast room are the best I have met in any hotel . They treat you like a family friend returned to visit. They pre-empt your needs.Like a taxi on the first morning of ITB !! The bar has a limited choice of wines but tell you what ! Each bottle is excellent . The breakfast room has the sun pouring in theough its beautiful large windows. And the cheese , the bread , the fruits , the cold cuts , the smorgasbord are all excellent. The small hot buffet is of the best quality .And the tea , coffee station with separate pots is perfect .After a good morning run on the stately Berlin streets this is the place you want to be ! But the biggest surprise is dinner! In a city like Berlin where you have a stunning variety of fantastic restaurants , we normally dont eat at the restaurant in the hotel . But last time I had an early morning flight and my guest could arrive only at 9 and I didnt want the Italian down the road . So we decided to eat in the restaurant.And I had arguably the best steak I have ever eaten ! With an excellent but not overpriced bottle of red wine. Excellent experience .Again a small menu but what I ate was delicious. Park Inn Emser Strasse rocks .

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant base in good location”
Reviews.Author: Amyeeee
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and of decent size, staff very friendly, and the area I would describe as a quiet Kensington version of Berlin. It took 5 mins walk from the U-bahn (metro), and 5 mins to Kurfunstendamn. There are some nice restaurants 2 mins walk away also. Reception provides essentials if you've forgotten anything like toothbrushes and razors, and the bathroom provides all in one shampoo/body wash. Negatives of hotel. We asked for a double room but as usually happens we got to single beds pushed together (I never understand why hotels do this?). Also pillow was very odd, it was like a sack, and then to make fuller you had to fold it. You had to pay for wifi and breakfast was 12 euros, so we decided to go to a cafe up the road which filled us up for about 4. But all of this was very minor and we were very happy with our stay :) WARNING ABOUT BERLIN TRAINS!!******** We didn't know about this, apparently its quite normal in some European countries. We got to the airport trainstation and there was no one about, but we managed to get a ticket (ABC single, cost 3 euros) and got on the right train. We noticed there was no date on it, thinking it was a bit odd, but there was a time, therefore we thought it'd be fine. WRONG. We got halfway, and were asked to leave the train by ticket inspectors, who told us that because we hadn't validated our tickets (aka used the stamp machines next to ticket machines which we hadn't even noticed to stamp todays date on) we had to pay a fine of 40 euros each!!! Thinking it was a scam, they took us to the information desk on the platform and confirmed their id was real. After protest they let us off with 40 between the two of us because we were tourists who didn't know. The experience really shook us up and we think it was incredibly unfair, and avoided using the trains apart from our journey back to the airport. I can't imagine how much money Berlin trains make from catching tourists out this way, so make sure the same doesn't happen to you!! I'll definitely be doing a lot more research on cities transports next time I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Valuer for money”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Kurfunstendamn area. Not very expensive. Unlike other Park Inn hotels it does not have tea/coffee in room, Internet is not free. So the level of service is very moderate. We have ordered many thing on ebay to be delivered to the hotel address. I'm very thankful to the hotel staff that they have stored all of them and kept until we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: damzkey
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because we got a very good offer. The hotel is located within walk distance from Fehrbelliner Platz and Hohenzollern Platz subway station. There are some nice restaurants and cafés nearby (ex: Weyers). The hotel staffs are nice, the room is modern and clean, and the bed is comfortable. However internet service is available with extra cost and all TV channels are in german. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel, and we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: toandem89
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel just after Thanksgiving and couldn't have been happier with the service. Anna Marie was particularly helpful, but her great customer service attitude and enthusiasm were evident in all of the staff. Our room on the 5rh floor had a little balcony and we loved being able to open the window or door to cool the room at night. Having never been to Berlin before, we picked the hotel primarily for price but found the location was good, especially for the neighborhood. Our restaurant recommendation would be Hamlet, turn right out the front door and then walk 2 blocks north and not quite 2 blocks east - by the 3rd day they were treating us like regulars! Overall, it was the hotel staff that made our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: foxy_lady2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel last weekend. The room was clean, comfortable, good size. The breakfast in the restaurant was really good, many choices and very good quality of food. Most impressive was the staff of the hotel. In the restaurant and reception, whom ever we asked for assistance, they were very friendly and helpfull. All overall we had a great time in Berlin and are looking forward to return. We can really recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No room, no aplology, no reply to emails!”
Reviews.Author: Angry_13
Reviews.Content: I'm generally quite easy about the service quality at hotels, particularly when on a leisure break, but for the Park Inn Berlin City West I have to make an exception. My wife and I had booked a long weekend during October, along with my brother and his partner. We'd booked well in advance, over 9 months previously, and were looking forward to the break. I'd chosen the Park Inn due to the good reviews and locality to the underground line. However, upon arriving we were told "there is a problem", and the lady walked off. She came back a short while later to explain, very matter-of-fact, that the hotel had been overbooked and we did not have a room. I found this hard to believe, firstly we had booked 9-months in advance and secondly it was only 11am in the morning so it was unlikely that all other people had checked in already. When I questioned this, I was given a very frank and honest answer. The hotel had received a block booking from a coach tour, and we had been gazumped. When I asked why they had chosen to do this, I was told it was more profitable for the hotel! Not exactly great customer service, but at least the receptionist (clearly this wasn't her choice) was honest. We were then told we had been booked into an alternative hotel, the Best Western a couple of kilometres away. After fruitless negotiation and a period of stunned surprise, we were eventually offered a taxi to the other hotel. I’ve stopped in hotels all over the world, and NEVER before have I had my room cancelled knowingly by the hotel because they could make more money from someone else! The BW hotel was fine, but listed itself as a 3* rather than the 4* hotel that we'd booked. Now, I'm not a hotel snob, but I expect to get what I'd paid for! The real annoyance was not being told. The hotel had our contact details, why not contact us and at least give us a choice to find our own accommodation? Upon return to the UK, I wrote an emailed letter of complaint to the hotel. A week later, after no response, I sent the email onto the Central Reservations team, and another week later, still after no reply, I sent again to all emails I could find for Park Inn. Eventually, I got a response from the hotel and an offer of an upgrade if I choose to visit Park Inn Berlin West again - not likely!!! Berlin was fun, the Zoo and Berlin Wall being the highlights along with some amazing beer and atmospheric pubs. The BW hotel staff were great, and by the end of the break we’d almost forgotten about the awful service from the Park Inn and the far from ideal start. My advice would be to give Park Inn Berlin West a wide berth and save yourself the stress. The service of the Park Inn group is awful, and they will never have my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, the rooms very clean tidy and spacious. The staff extremely friendly and helpful. We had dinner, whilst the menu is small and limited, the food was very good, tasty. The hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facilities, decent price”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: Ok, just a quick one you know what you get with a park inn and this one is no different, its clean well appointed rooms ( for the price) are all present. The TV's are little outdated ( not flatscreen) there's no free wifi and only 1 english speaking tv channel ( bbc world, which I actually really like so no major problem) unless you pay £12 for a basic sky pack. Bathroom clean, shower good pressure bath adequate sized. So why is worth writing a review? The location, which is awesome, its on the edge of Chalottenburg and is surrounded by great little bars cafes and restaurants, its near a u-bahn station, two taxi ranks and everywhere in central Berlin is walkable with 40 minutes. The hotel itself is on a quiet street so no noise at night. It is a far far better option than the big park inn on alexanderplastz, which whilst newer and swankier is surrounded by McDonalds and dunking donuts, not my thing but maybe its yours Overall for the price (145 euros for three nights in a double room) is excellent value for an average but excellently placed hotel in the coolest central district of Berlin.....oh and the staff were really helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: kaytraveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was good value, got a good deal for four nights through Radisson's website. It's a bit "far", I suppose, but Berlin has a superb underground network that takes you anywhere. The rooms are far from modern (could use an update), and at least in this room there were two separate beds instead of a single double bed. But the room was clean, quite big and had plenty of storage space. I usually sleep wearing earplugs, so I can't really say anything regarding soundproofing in the hotel - but I thought it was quiet, it's situated nicely on a sort of "sidestreet" in a sleepy neighbourhood. There's a school next to it if your room is on that side (and those kids are pretty loud...), but during the weekend the school is obviously shut. The area surrounding the hotel is really nice, there's a really nice park within a walking distance. Ku'damm takes a while to walk to, I'd say your best bet is really to walk to one of the nearby underground stations (which are a short walk away too, mind you).

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hansumstranga
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Berlin for the first time for the weekend to run in my first, and last marathon and decided to stay here! It is quiet,clean,very convenient to the underground and I found the staff excellent! I couldn't find fault with it although it is slightly expensive but this may have been because the marathon was on and there would have been high demand for hotel rooms. When I returned to the hotel after completing the marathon, the staff were fantastic. I had requested a late check out which was no problem and so I was able to have a bath/shower and pack at leisure. They did what they could to make things easy for me and I was even able to get some dinner before the restaurant opened as I had to catch my flight home. I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “totally overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_skywalker
Reviews.Content: I booked a 'standard room with double bed' for 2 nights. Upon arrival I asked for a quiet room on a high floor. I was given a single room with a single bed on the 5th floor facing the street and a football playground. I went back to the desk and told the girl that it said a standard room/double bed when I booked and she said 'when only 1 person is using the room we give them the single.' I asked if it was possible to be upgraded, 'no.' The room was very used/shoddy furniture, a 2 star rating. I did not sleep well so next day I told the next girl at the desk that I would not be staying the second night. She did not ask why and checked me out. I asked if I could print my boarding pass and she said there would be a charge to do this so I said forget and just left. In summary, a 2 star room with a 0 star service. On the plus side, the area surrounding the hotel is really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen-Phil
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable room, in a good quiet location, handy to U-Bahn and only 10 minute walk to Kurfurstendam, Duty manager was very helpful on checkin and translating on my mobile phone as I dont speak German, breakfast was ok, had dinner one night and was a nice meal, waiter a little distressed due to group booking, and working by himself, dark curtains would be a welcome addition. Comfy bed and nice clean Bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIBI3
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel , 10-15 minutes walk from the qu dum. Clean rooms, but without wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and friendly hotel with access to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Mixreview
Reviews.Content: Traveling with friends, we chose this hotel from a list provided by the travel company. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located in a residential area away from main thoroughfares. The local U-Bahn, Fehrberliner Platz, is a 5 minutes walk away. Once there, the city is your oyster. We also walked up to the Kurfurstendamm, Kaiser Wilhelm Church, KDW in 10 mins. On the same street, there are a few local bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The rooms were nicely appointed. Our had twin mattresses close enough together to have the appearance of a double bed. The bathroom was clean with a nice powerful shower. Mini-fridge and TV were included but sadly no tea/coffee making facilities. We didn't eat in the hotel. It looked like plenty of guests ate breakfast there but the evening restaurant didn't look that popular. It's probably because there's so much available, at a slightly cheaper price, locally. The staff we very helpful and spoke English as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Rezidor rates their Park Inns as a 3 star-hotel group, while”
Reviews.Author: GUMOslo
Reviews.Content: official hotel certifications presents it as a 4 star hotel . . . it is a nice 3 star hotel in a quiet living area not far away from Ku`damm. A nice nearby restaurant is "Hermanns Einkehr" offering German specialities. There are some nice restaurants in the Savigny area, too.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRBRS
Reviews.Content: I must compliment the General Manager for his presence and proactiveness while running this hotel. The in the Front Desk and Restaurant are pleasant and helpful. rooms are functional and clean . I was staying while attending the ITB and found this hotel value for money . Definately recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Great night stay”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: We spent the night here on our way to a wedding in Poland. Was a great place, loved the rooms, breakfast was a little expensive but most hotels breakfasts are a little over priced. Enjoyed the location, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A combination of quality, cleanness of the room and convinience in terms of location”
Reviews.Author: Nastik_K
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect city break in Berlin back in December. Although it was a short stay we enjoyed it greatly as after every day, full of impressions it was so pleasant to return to our cosy and clean hotel. First of all the bathroom (it is the most important place for me) was spot on, shiny and white. The room itself was also very neat with a huge window. The only drawback was the thin wall (that used to be a door between the next room) so that we heard the movements and even voices of our neighborous. But you can always swich on your TV or sing a song loud enough=) The location was perfect – only 10 minutes from the Metro and from the busy boulevard. The most pleasant thing – we got this room for around 100 pounds per three nights and comparing to the hotel in Paris we visited later, it was twice cheaper and ten times better in terms of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good place in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: MaffyUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the weekend and found this to be a good hotel although the location was a bit far from the centre for tourists like me. On the plus side, the hotel was immaculately clean and quiet. There were extensive conference rooms facilitates and all the other guests I saw were clearly on a work trip. The place appears to be geared up for the business traveller so if you are a tourist do not expect any excitement or a rowdy bar scene, just a good nights sleep. My only criticism would be that there was no safe in the room and that no shampoo or conditioner were supplied, just a body wash in the en suite.

Reviews.Title: “Super little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleeps2go
Reviews.Content: A quality hotel at a reasonable price, quite location, close to the U7 with links to the airport, and only a few minutes walk to the Ku Dam. Staff were friendly and efficient, the hotel was clean with good beds and had good public areas i.e. bar and lounge. We will book again if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Bilip
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel...helpful staff,the size of the room,bathroom,breakfast etc.A short walk got us to Kufurstendam through a quiet area.Small shops also along the way.Thoroughly pleased so would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: B_Norway
Reviews.Content: Very quiet area, but with the tube station and nice places to eat just a few minutes walk away. Ask at the reception, they are most useful. The American Diner was a hit with our daughter! Cleanliness OK, vacuuming could be a little more thoroughly, but the bathroom was nice every day. Bed linen was not changed during our five day stay, but after all I do not change it more often at home either, and less cleaning is environmently wise, so I will not pout about it. And I'm sure they would have changed it if I asked them. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Transport Links!”
Reviews.Author: stokie_gem
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for 5 days and really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the rooms are massive, the bar is lovely, outside of Berlin centre but doesnt take long to get there and the S/U Bahn station is just round the corner great for town and the airport as you can just jump on and walk to the hotel! Beds were great, got such a good nights sleep it was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: HTWales
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my daughter and her boyfriend as a birthday treat, and she tells me it was really great. Convenient location. Clean, well-equipped rooms. But what really impressed her was the staff, the friendliest and most helpful she's ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: NorwayAl38
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little hotel. Spotlessly clean, well furnished and spacious rooms, very reasonably priced. On a map, it looks as if it's off the beaten track but it is only 5 mins walk from the U-Bahn station or the Kurfurstendamm.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice when going to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bruns
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights in July when we went to the U2 concert in Berlin last year. While the Park Inn Berlin West is not the most central hotel, its located in a residential area, its still located very close to U-bahn (Metro) and the famous Kurfürstendam street (15 min walk). In the immediate surroundings there are some restaurants, but nothing much else. As for the hotel, it has a pretty big parking garage, and a nice clean reception. The people in the reception where very nice and helpful regarding the few questions we had. The rooms where ok sized, and very comfy. I would at any time recommend staying at this hotel, especially if you want to stay off the beaten path, and enjoy some quiet surroundings. As for the U2 concert, that was simply brilliant, best concert ever :)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: foubrac
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean, friendly, fairly spacious room, good restaurant. What else does one need? Location was not the best (not a whole lot a round but close to subway station). Room was very clean with all furniture in very good shape. Staff was extremely friendly. We had asked for a larger room and other specific requests and the staff managed to accommodate us very well. Kudos. Bathroom was spacious and clean. Worked very well. Ground floor restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced (but not cheap). Very convenient parkade with direct access to the hotel. I was actually thinking about going for only four stars because nothing was really outstanding, but then absolutely everything was very good and as a package it is quite rare to find so many good things in a single hotel. So, exactly the kind of hotel we love and that deserves a five stars in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient”
Reviews.Author: jim2608
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night break over New Year. As most other reviewers have said, it is a pretty good hotel. Modern rooms, decent breakfast and friendly staff. Although some sites advise Fehrbelliner Platz as the nearest metro stop, but we found Hohenzollernplatz just as close, and it is "towards" the centre of town. It's a brisk 10 minute walk to Kuf'damm (with shops and restaurants). There are a couple of restaurants at the end of the street the hotel is on. (Emser Strasse) Transport-wise Berlin is great - we landed at Berlin Tegel at 6.30 and were in our hotel room by 7.15!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: At a place near you soon
Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: merlinthe3rd
Reviews.Content: Settled on the Avalon after checking out many reviews on Tripadvisor for hotels in Berlin. Ok it say's it's 4* but it's really a good 3* hotel ,reasonably priced, room very clean ,staff very nice & polite, even had a bath as well as a shower which i like .quiet area & only a few minutes walk to the u-bahn & about 5 minutes walk to the Kur'damm . A couple of American 50's diners nearby ! jimmy's was very good give it a try ! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HEC
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break in Berlin, booked all very last minute. When we arrived we were made to feel very welcome and the gentleman on reception was very helpful. The hotel rooms are a good size, only downside was no aircon, but we were there in August, but there were nice big windows you could open! Berlin is a huge place and the transport system is excellent, the hotel is less than 5 minutes to an underground station. You do have a couple of lines to cross to get to a main line, but we managed fine, and it was nice to have the tranquility of the hotel on your return. The breakfast was good as others have said it was laid on four hours most days, we were surprised thought it would be continental but there was hot foot, scrambled egg, streaky bacon, boiled eggs, very nice. We had a great time, would recommend big fat bike tours, leave from the TV tower at Alexandra platz (think that's right) we had a fab time really enjoyed it. Also went to a show the blue man group, not cheap but we thouroughly enjoyed it. Hec

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: The_Old_Buffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avalon for a week in May. It is very smart situated. Close to buses, U-bahn and is at a very calm part of the town. Kind and interested personal, clean and nice room. Perhaps with too much furniture. Good value for money. We'll stay there next time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with some good features”
Reviews.Author: bettoneyvere
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a quiet residential part of Berlin but still not too far from the 'attractions' either by foot or by metro or S-bahn. The hotel is more 3* than 4*. I had an end of corridor room overlooking the small park at the back so it was quite quiet which I like. The decor was a bit dated but the room was clean ... and a good size, which is often unusual in European hotels. There is no air conditioning so the rooms could be quite hot in the middle of summer. Good bathroom (nice bath). Basic toiletries. Mini bar okay. Excellent breakfast. Staff very helpful. Wifi was a bit expensive (Euro 46 for 4 days) although there is a free terminal in the lobby. My main quibble is that on two nights that I was there the restaurant was closed in the evening (because of a tour group or private party or something). There are lots of good restaurants in the area, but sometimes it's nice to be able to eat where one is staying, particularly for a solo woman traveller. I'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend at the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: Pappito
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Avalon to be a nice place to stay. Staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was plentiful, both hot and cold, and kept us going for the morning ahead. A ten minute walk takes you to the main shopping street, The Kurfustendmm. The Underground is just a short walk around the corner from the hotel. We would use the hotel again. We had a great stay. Up the road from the hotel, is Route 66, an American diner. Food is good, large portions, quick service,not too expensive, and it has a nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “NICE 3* STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Emmie-Scot
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very clean and tidy. The rooms were a good size and well kept. The Avalon calls itself a 4* hotel, I would say that it was a good 3*. Breakfast was a let down, the hot food wasn't replenished, and from about 9am onwards there was little left which was cold. Service was okay, not overly friendly but pleasant. The hotel is a bit out of the way from the city centre, and you really need to get about 2 underground lines to get anywhere. There is an underground station about 5-10 mins walk away from the hotel, the maps were easy to understand and a train came every 5 mins. There is an american diner and bars and the top of the Emser Strasse (where the hotel is located), unfortunately, we only discovered these on our last morning when we went for a walk after breakfast so I cannot comment on them. All other facilities are in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jules1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed and good for transport. You could get the bus just round the corner every 10 minutes into Zoo station and there was an underground not far away. We walked to the main shopping area Kurfurstendamm a few times as well. The rooms were a bit basic but warm with a television and very clean. The breakfast was good with cereals, bread, yoghurts, meats, cheese, eggs etc. All the staff were friendly. Very good value for money

HotelInfo.Name: Park Inn by Radisson Berlin City West
HotelInfo.Address: Emser Strasse 6, 10719 Berlin, Germany
